Agronomic_Notes: Split N: 50% basal, 25% tillering, 25% PI. Hybrids may need 150+ N.
Lower dose due to low moisture & yield potential.
Residue moisture conservation requires low inputs.
Dual purpose varieties need balanced N:K.
High N response; ranges up to 100.
K response low in arid K-rich soils.
High N increases protein (bad for malt).
Needs S (20 kg), Zn, B, Mo.
Zn often limiting in rice fallows.
High P+S; Zn critical in Vertisols.
High Boron demand; B deficiency sensitive.
Huge K demand; N split into 3–4.
Too much N causes flower drop.
Mo deficiency (whiptail) common in acid soils.
High B + Mo demand; browning due to B deficiency.
